intro: Ellipanthus calophyllus, commonly known as the broad-leaved ellipanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in shrubland or rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native environment.
